instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> short to ground nothing heats up
threads.message: Injected 1v 1a into <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and nothing got the slightest bit warm. Thought I was crazy but freeze spray revealed nothing also.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> short to ground nothing heats up
threads.message:
Be sure first no short between <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and any coil.
How can you inject 1V/1A into pure short???
It requires more than 10A; if is really pure short.

Use 10-20A lab PSU and set amp limit to max first.
Limiting the current to 1A didn't inject anything in fact.
The PSU went in protection mode.
